My Dearest Palak,

There's something incredibly therapeutic about pouring one's heart out, right? Especially to the one for whom these unexpressed words are intended. Itâ€™s like unburdening the soul, letting emotions flow freely, and finding solace in the act of expression.

I loved you and for a long time, I never expressed my feelings for you. Of course, I had told you once that I loved you. But itâ€™s never just that, right? Thereâ€™s a plethora of feelings and actions, memories and dreams, associated with these three words, which I never got to communicate to you. And it bothered me for a long, long time. 13 years. Nothing hurts more than unsaid words.

And I am really glad that now, I get to share these things with you. It feels as if in my otherwise chaotic life, I've discovered a secret doorway to a place of peace within you. It's a sanctuary where every emotion, every sentiment, and every raw feeling has a voiceâ€¦

In our conversation the other day, I truly meant it when I said that sending these letters makes me feel better and sane. And the unspoken understanding that radiated from your response â€“ 'I know, I understand' - meant the world to me. Those four words felt like a comforting embrace for my soul.

Your understanding is a lifeline in a world that feels chaotic and unpredictable. It's a reminder that even in the vastness of existence, there are those rare connections where words don't need to be dissected or analyzed â€“ they just need to be felt.

It's not just about the letters; it's about the empathy that you extend, creating a safe space for vulnerability. It's a treasure beyond measure.

Having said that, you are not obligated to read or response to these letters. In fact, if you ever feel uncomfortable, just say it and I will stop sending you these letters.

Hereafter, I will post all my letters here. However, I am not going to share this website with you nowâ€¦ I will send only some of them to you directly. Because some of these letters might really make you feel uncomfortable. And I donâ€™t want to piss you offâ€¦

Anyway, thank you, truly and deeply. In your understanding, I find solace, and in your understanding, I find home.

With love, hugs and other things,
Pritam
